# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a concise implementation of `wrap_string`:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    current_line = ""
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= isempty(current_line) ? word : " " * word
        end
    end
    result *= current_line
end

# Example usage
text = "This is an example to demonstrate wrapping of strings using Julia language."
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

This code will wrap the string `text` at every `text_width` characters, ensuring each word is intact and not broken across lines.
